title: 108_hr5319
content: The Act titled "Renewable Energy Financing Incentive Act of 2004" allows for nonrecognition of gain from the sale of real property upon subsequent purchase of renewable energy property under section 1046 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act allows for nonrecognition of gain from the sale of real property if the taxpayer elects to apply section 1046, acquires renewable energy property, and the sale gives rise to gain. Gain will only result to the extent that the sale price exceeds the cost of the renewable energy property acquired. Gain will only result if the sale price exceeds the cost of the renewable energy property acquired. Definitions and special rules apply, including the definition of renewable energy property as a facility in the US using renewable energy sources for electricity generation or fuel manufacturing. An interest in a partnership is treated as an interest in each of the partnership's assets. The basis of renewable energy property is the same as the exchanged property, adjusted for money received and gain or loss recognized. Recapture rules apply. The taxpayer's gain or loss on renewable energy property is recognized upon disposition, with recapture rules applying to any previously unrecognized gain. The statute of limitations for assessing deficiencies on gains from the sale or exchange of renewable energy property is extended to 3 years from the date the taxpayer notifies the Secretary of such gain. The amendments made by Section 1046 allow for nonrecognition of gain from the sale of real property upon subsequent purchase of renewable energy property, effective for real property sold after December 31, 2004.
